page.title: 02Landscape
page.content: The landscape is mainly taken up by farmland.Much of this is divided into small fields of 7-10 acres average size.The fields are separated by dense hedges of hawthorn,elderberry,holly and ash,with mature trees scattered among them.The hedges provide valuable shelter for the animals. There is also much rough grazing land for sheep and horses.The land here is unfertilized and gorse bushes are commonly seen.Cultivated fields consist mainly of barley and oats. Thorsgill Beck and Deepdale Beck run through the area ({beck is a local {name for stream}) with many deciduous trees along their banks. Kilmond Scar,a limestone outcrop,is a series of small,steep cliffs. Boldron Village is the only built-up area of any size.Disused quarries are a common feature of the landscape.
